results.title: Crew in Imparja TV studio
results.brief_description: In 1998, the Central Australian Aboriginal Media Association (CAAMA) launched the world’s first Indigenous owned and operated TV network, Imparja Television. Along with the establishment of Indigenous Community Television (ICTV) in 2001, these early initiatives paved the way for today’s broadcasters

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Australia → MA-07. First Peoples: Our stories, our way → MA-07-04 Birth of Indigenous Broadcasting

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 5. Season 2. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Julie McSwiney, Ray Boseley, David Swann, Bernadette O'Mahony, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: Marcello alienates himself from the team when he uses a ‘cheat’ website to help him beat Bec in the school essay contest. Episode 7: After Bec returns from a trip to Silicon Valley in the USA, her cocky too-cool-for-school attitude threatens the effectiveness of the team. Episode 8: Marcello’s latest scheme, a “virtual band”, takes off and he becomes, on paper at least, a millionaire. But has he really hit the big time? Episode 9: A famous hacker steals Alex’s new game. When Marcello realises the hacker is someone he knows he has to make a difficult decision. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Bill Onus campaigns ‘Vote Yes for Aboriginal Rights’
results.credit_line: Courtesy AAP Image / National Library of Australia
results.brief_description: Yorta Yorta activist, artist and entrepreneur Bill Onus shared his culture as an act of resistance and reclamation of power. He helped establish the Aborigines Advancement League and campaigned for the ‘YES’ vote in the 1967 Referendum.
results.title_for_label: Bill Onus campaigns ‘Vote Yes for Aboriginal Rights’
results.description: Bill Onus, President of the Victorian Aborigines’ Advancement League (right), participating as the only Aboriginal in the march for Aboriginal Rights referendum on May 29, 1967.
description_for_label: Bill Onus, President of the Victorian Aborigines’ Advancement League (right), participating as the only Aboriginal in the march for Aboriginal Rights referendum on May 29, 1967.
results.credit_line_for_label: Courtesy AAP Image / National Library of Australia

results.title: Prisoner fanzine
results.brief_description: Prisoner packed a punch when it premiered in 1979. Set in the fictional suburb of Wentworth, the female-centred prison drama reverberated around the world, spawning international adaptations and a massive cult following.
results.description: Black and White A4 fanzine published in 1996 Issue 7 January for television series Prisoner
description_for_label: Black and White A4 fanzine published in 1996 Issue 7 January for television series Prisoner
